com.yantra.yfs.japi.util

Interface YFSAuthenticatorEx


  • public interface YFSAuthenticatorEx
    This interface needs to be implemented only if a custom authentication mechanism is required within the application. If custom authentication is required, set yfs.security.authenticator property to the name of Java class which implements this interface. This property is defined in yfs.properties file. The Map returned by the authenticator can provide two things: a warning to the user that the password will expire and a link that can be used to forward them to the password management screen.


    Example:
       import java.util.Map;
   import com.yantra.yfs.japi.util.YFSAuthenticator;
   public class MyAuthenticatorImpl implements YFSAuthenticator {
       public Map authenticate(YFCElement userElementPassed, YFCElement userElementFromDB) throws Exception {
           // retrieve user credentials from userElementPassed
                          // validate user credentials with given password
           // If authentication failed, throw Exception
           // else if password expires soon,
           //   Map.put("ExpiresInDays",number of days)
           //   Map.put("ChangePasswordLink",html link to password management screen)
           //
           // return Map
           //
       }
   }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map authenticate(YFCElement userElementPassed, YFCElement userElementFromDB)
      This method is invoked by the security manager whenever authentication needs to be performed.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        java.util.Map authenticate(YFCElement userElementPassed,
                           YFCElement userElementFromDB)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is invoked by the security manager whenever authentication needs to be performed. This is called ONLY when custom authentication is enabled. userElementPassed user details as YFCElement of the user who is being authenticated userElementFromDB user details as YFCElement of the user who is being authenticated - retireved from database based on userElementPassed Map can contain ExpiresInDays and ChangePasswordLink Exception if authentication fails, or YFSUseInternalAuthException if internal authentication should be performed instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
